data.book_spec:
Genre: Psychological Thriller
Place: New York City
Time: Present day (Autumn 2025–Spring 2026)
Theme: The corrosive cost of secrets and the price of truth.
Tone: grounded, unsentimental, and restrained
Point of View: Third-person limited, alternating between two main characters.
Characters: Mara Chen (34) - investigative journalist, estranged from her father; driven to expose a dangerous cover-up; stubborn, relentless; sharp researcher. Elias Rook (42) - corporate fixer and antagonist; intent on burying the truth; charming, ruthless; wide influence network. Dr. Sahana Patel (50) - data scientist turned whistleblower; wants to prevent harm; anxious but principled; holds key evidence. Javier Lobo (29) - ex-cop rideshare driver; needs cash and redemption; hot-headed; street savvy with police contacts. Ruthie Park (62) - community organizer; fights for her neighborhood; pragmatic; political leverage. Noah Chen (31) - ER nurse and Mara's brother; wants to keep family safe; loyal but risk-averse; access to hospital intel.
Premise: A municipal IT auditor uncovers a hidden algorithm rerouting public-housing applicants to for-profit landlords tied to the mayor’s top donor; partnering with a displaced family to expose it, she faces smear campaigns, legal threats, and a choice between protecting her career or blowing the city’s corruption open.
